etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Royal Statistical Society. From techno- + -graphy

definitions: The observation, description, and study of technologies and their application, especially within a particular social or historical context; an instance of this.
The use of information technology to focus and facilitate the running of a meeting, by having a person take notes which are immediately displayed for discussion by the participants.

notes.text: A trademark in the United States.
